snippet: Ms. Douglas was praised for her attention to the nuances of Southern speech and for her unflinching but sympathetic characterizations.
abstract: Ellen Douglas, Mississippi-born writer whose novels explore the surprisingly tender alliances between black and white women in the American South, dies at age 91.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Douglas was praised for her attention to the nuances of Southern speech and for her unflinching but sympathetic characterizations.

headline.seo: Ellen Douglas, Southern Novelist, Dies at 91
headline.main: Ellen Douglas, Novelist of Southern Life, Dies at 91
headline.print_headline: Ellen Douglas, Novelist of Southern Life, Dies at 91
